actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 906, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Johnson (OH) amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Johnson (OH),  numbered 1 printed in Part A of House Report 118-298 to clarify the time-frame in which the bill's requirements apply.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 4468.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4468, H.R. 5933 and H.J. Res. 88. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4468 and H.R. 5933 under a structured rule and H.J. Res. 88 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each measure.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 906. H.R. 4468 â€” "To prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from finalizing, implementing, or enforcing a proposed rule with respect to emissions from vehicles, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Murphy to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Scott Franklin to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
